results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Tim Kanoa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.

results.title: Peep-peep-peep
results.brief_description: Puppet animated film about the Wombles who live under Wimbledon Common in London. In this episode the Wombles discover a crude version of the telephone by using tins and string. Based on the children’s book series The Wombles by Elizabeth Beresford. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

holdings.name: 16mm film; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Emulation of Mugsy's Revenge for Commodore 64
results.brief_description:
As in the original Mugsy this strategy game is presented in a highly visual style with lots of detailed comic-book style stills and short animations. As a gangster in 1919, you see an opportunity to make money by illegally supplying alcohol during the Prohibition era in the US. Hints as to all decisions in the game are given through textual conversations with your assistants - these can include how much booze to produce, how big a bribe to give, and whether to invest in your own Speakeasy bar later on.

Unlike the original game, there are some arcade sequences which involve running around and shooting down the police as they try to arrest you. The character can be hit up to 5 times but it only takes one shot to take out a cop. After each of the game’s 10 years you receive a screen updating you on your progress, as well as a special one if you and your business survives the full decade. [Sourced from https://www.mobygames.com/game/16653/mugsys-revenge//]

results.title: Faster pussycat kill, kill. Mondo topless
results.creator_credit: Russ Meyer, Eve Meyer and Eve Productions
results.brief_description: Russ Meyer made famous this b-grade exploitation style of popular culture and in his films explored the people living on the edge or outside of the mainstream culture of the day. “Faster Pussycat Kill! Kill!” a cult classic centres around three women who are on a wild rampage of violence and revenge, a new breed of violence where sex is it’s favourite mantle and terrorizing people the order of the day. These “homicidal go-go’s” start their journey with a drag race across the desert followed by a violent showdown with local ranchers. The film is filled with hard-line one-liners, for example in answering the question “What’s the point?” the ringleader vixen Varla (Tura Satana) replies “The point is of no return, and you’ve just crossed it”. The second film “Mondo Topless” equally a cult classic is a montage of topless go-go dancers accompanied with voice overs from the dancers talking about their trade, motivations and views of their sexuality.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
results.description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.

results.title: Wool: fashion's choice for '62
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Models strut the latest wool fashions, using locations around Melbourne as their backdrop. Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.

results.title: The Legend of John Henry: an American folk tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, David Adams, Nick Bosustow and Pyramid Films

video_links.name: The Legend of John Henry: an American folk tale

results.brief_description: Animated folk tale about John Henry, an African American, and his endeavour to cut a railroad tunnel through a mountain. Sung by Roberta Flack.
